summary: A music mod that adds new non-replacer (standalone) music to combat, exploration, and areas. Also replaces the default main menu music with various remixes of the original Skyrim music (optional).
descriptionHtml:
[img]http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/images/30485-1-1359432218.jpg[/img]
=========================================================================================
=========================================================================================
[b]READ THE UPDATE AND CHANGELOG[/b]

A music mod that adds new non-replacer (standalone) music to combat, exploration, and areas. Also replaces the default main menu music with various remixes of the original Skyrim music (optional).

[b]New Standalone (non-replacer) Music List:[/b] 

-- Secunda - Classic Guitar - Taverns and Inns
-- From Past to Present - Classic Guitar - Taverns and Inns
-- Far Horizons - Classic guitar - Tavern and Inns
-- Watch the Skies - Guitar Medley - Boss Fights 
-- Sons of Skyrim - Guitar Medley - Boss Fights 
-- Sons of Skyrim - Epic Metal - Boss Fights 
-- Sons of Skyrim - Violin - Combat 
-- From Past to Present - Violin - Exploration 
-- Theme of the North - Orchestra - Exploration
-- Oblivion Battle Remix - Boss Fights
-- The Elder Scrolls Main Theme - Guitar Medley - Boss Fights  [url=https://soundcloud.com/pyrobunta/the-elder-scrolls-battle]Listen Here[/url]

You can use all optional files together should you want to.
[b]POST YOUR REQUESTS ON THE COMMENT SECTION IF YOU\'D LIKE ANY OF THESE SONGS TO BE PLAYED IN DIFFERENT AREAS (as an exploration theme, combat theme, or whatever)[/b]
=========================================================================================
=========================================================================================
[b]Main Menu Music List:[/b]

-- Sons of Skyrim - Epic Metal Remix 
-- Sons of Skyrim - Violin Cover 
-- Sons of Skyrim - Piano Cover
-- Watch the Skies - Piano Cover
-- Watch the Skies - Guitar Medley
-- The One they Fear - Piano Cover
-- The Elder Scrolls III-IV-V Main Themes - Piano Cover
-- The Elder Scrolls Main Theme - Ocarina [url=https://soundcloud.com/pyrobunta/the-elder-scrolls-main-theme]Listen Here[/url]
-- The Elder Scrolls Main Theme - Orchestra

=========================================================================================
[b]Note regarding Jason Young\'s Violin Cover[/b]: There\'s also another mod that has the same (full version) of the violin cover. However this one has been edited to fit in more directly to the main menu music. The full version has a long intro using one of the town music, which makes players barely have any time or chance to listen to the music before they start their game.
=========================================================================================

==== [b]UPDATE[/b] ===
Starting v1.4 I will be adding non-replacer music for things other than the main menu (I.E combat music, exploration music, dungeon music, etc...) on the OPTIONAL FILES section. I will add things every now and then, so be sure to check back once in a while.

[b[Also, you\'ll have to update your main file every time I add in new music if you want to get them.[/b]


[b]PLEASE REPORT ANY PROBLEMS AND BUGS YOU COME ACROSS. MAKE SURE TO INSTALL PROPERLY.[/b]
=========================================================================================
=========================================================================================
[b]CHANGELOG[/b]

v2.0 Added 2 new main menu replacers, 2 boss fight music, and a new exploration theme. Fixed some grammar errors.

v1.9.1 Fixed the tavern music volume being too low. Download the updated music file again to fix it.

v1.9 Added one new main menu music replacer and fixed some mistakes on the descriptions.

v1.8.1 Minor changes and added the Watch the Skies - Guitar Medly available as main menu music as well.

v1.8 Major overhaul fixing issue where not all music will play. Added in also a patch for Fantasy Music Overhaul Redone.

v1.7 Added three new classic guitar covers for Inns and Taverns. Also moved the videos to the video section.

v1.6.1 Added an article on the article section and moved one of the mistakenly placed Main Files to the Optional Files.

v1.6 Added two new guitar medley boss fight music by Jam2995 \"Jake\"

v1.5 Added three new piano covers by Taioo

v1.4.1 Forgot to add uninstallation and upgrading instructions.

v1.4 Revamped the optional files by switching to xwm format that saves more space and better quality (basically like mp3). Epic Metal Remix also added as optional Dragon fight non-replacer music.

v1.3 Added the violin cover (second half) as an optional combat theme (non-replacer)

v1.2 Added the violin cover (first half) as an optional exploration theme (non-replacer)

v1.1 I\'ve added new main files that combines both music together to play on the main menu, and another that has the Epic Metal Remix Extended instead. Fixed a lot of description and link errors.

v1.0 Initial release
=========================================================================================
=========================================================================================

[b]INSTALLATION[/b]

For the OPTIONAL FILES, first get the required [b]SkyMusicRemix Main File[/b]. Then you can safely download and install any of the optional files. Note: The main file only contains the esp and only the optional files contain the actual music. If you have Fantasy Music Overhaul Redone installed, also get the Fantasy Music Overhaul Compatibility Patch.

With Nexus Mod Manager just install them normally. If you\'d like to install manually, just extract the Data folder to your Skyrim folder. Note that the \"Menu Music\" files will overwrite any other main menu music mods you have installed. The optional files will not overwrite anything and can be installed normally.

[b]UNINSTALLATION[/b]

Just uninstall via Nexus Mod Manager, or if you manual installed, remove the esp files and delete Skyrim/Data/Music/PyroMus folder.
========================================================================================
NOTE: [b]Uninstall the old versions of the main files before upgrading, if you used files BEFORE v1.7[/b]
========================================================================================

[b]COMPATIBILITY:[/b] This mod is NOT compatible with NON-REPLACER music mods without a compatibility patch (notify me if you want me to make a compatibility patch for a non-replacer music mod you have). Except the main menu music files that will overwrite your current vanilla or modded main menu music.

[b]LOAD ORDER:[/b] Any should work, but I suggest to put them on the middle.

[i]Please remember to [b]Endorse[/b] if you liked the mod[/i]. Enjoy :D
=========================================================================================
[b]SPECIAL THANKS TO:

--Jeremy Soule for the original TESV: Skyrim Music Tracks

-- Jason Young (http://www.youtube.com/user/JasonYangViolin)
-- Brendon Strader (http://www.youtube.com/user/bestrader)
-- Taioo (http://www.youtube.com/user/taioo)
-- Jam2995 \"Jake\" (http://www.youtube.com/jam2995)
-- Harry Murrell (http://www.youtube.com/user/HarryMurrell)
-- FamilyJules7X (http://www.youtube.com/user/FamilyJules7X)
-- Pascal Michael Stiefel (http://www.youtube.com/user/Plasma3Music)
-- Digital Piece (http://www.youtube.com/user/DigitalPiece)

...for their awesome reiterations of the original The Elder Scrolls music.[/b]
=========================================================================================
Planned updates:
- Adding more music, probably.

[i][b]Check out my [url=http://www.gamefaqs.com/boards/615805-the-elder-scrolls-v-skyrim/65511363]Skyrim Mods, Tips, and Recommendation Guide[/url] for Skyrim mod recommendations[/b][/i] 


If you want a more lore-friendly music mod, I\'d point you to [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/28583]Fantasy Music Overhaul[/url] which is a brilliant music mod that I also use myself. Be sure to check it out.
author: Nofumasa
